Apart from the renewable energy sector, Cottbus has also seen some growth in other sectors over the past decade. One of these is the tourism sector. The city has a rich cultural heritage, which makes it an attractive destination for visitors. Additionally, the city has invested in the development of its infrastructure, including hotels and other tourism-related facilities.

Another industry that has contributed to the economic growth of Cottbus is the manufacturing sector. The city has a tradition of industrial manufacturing, and over the years, it has established itself as a hub for the production of textiles and clothing. Additionally, the city has been making efforts to attract new companies in the manufacturing sector, especially in the high-tech industry.

Furthermore, the city has also been promoting the development of the service sector. This has resulted in the growth of business services, such as consulting and accounting firms. Cottbus has also been promoting the establishment of start-ups, which has contributed to the growth of the tech sector in the city.

So, while the renewable energy sector has been a major contributor to the economic growth of Cottbus over the past decade, the city has also seen some growth in other sectors, including tourism, manufacturing, and the service sector.
